title: Odd Function Property
text: An odd function satisfies the property: $$f(-a)$$ $$=$$ $$-f(a)$$.

title: Odd Function Property
text: The sine function is odd, which means: $$sin(-\theta)$$ $$=$$ $$-sin(\theta)$$. So for $$sin(-x)$$, we have $$sin(-x)=-sin(x)$$.

title: Substitute into the Expression
text: Now, substitute $$sin(-x)$$ into $$(-x)sin(-x)$$: $$(-x)sin(-x)=(-x)(-sinx)=xsinx$$. We are given that $$xsin(x)=2$$, thus $$(-x)sin(-x)=xsin(x)=2$$
